segments.text: Come in and have some coffee , Anna . The kids have just gone out to the mall to hang out with their friends .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I saw a lot of teenagers when Alan and I were there yesterday .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They spend hours there , especially on weekends .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Speaking of that trip , Alan bought a shirt at a department store , but the sleeves are too long . Do you know a seamstress or tailor who can shorten them ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I know several . But wouldn ’ t it be easier to take the shirt back and exchange it for the right size ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , it ’ s easy . We ’ ll just take the shirt back to the men ’ s department and show them the sales slip . They ’ ll exchange it for the correct size or give you a refund .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We ? Do you want to go with me ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sure . I love going to the mall .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What do you do there ... hang around , like the kids ?
segments.speaker: S2
